chunks.en: I am independently developing a markdown WYSIWYG editor, and I hope everyone can give some suggestions (requirements, optimization, experience, future direction)

chunks.en:
- Lightweight, high-performance WYSIWYG editing
  - Smooth editing of 50,000-line markdown text without lag
  - Can replace any text input box, with markdown rich text capabilities
- High-performance mobile support
- AI input support, incremental rendering of AI-output markdown text
- Supports plain text data or CRDT collaborative data storage

[demo]( https://www.domd.app/)   [vscode plugin]( https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Jayden.wysiwyg&ssr=false#overview)
The background is black as soon as it appears, and I thought your website was stuck
You can add a placeholder to the official website, otherwise people might think it hasn't loaded
1. Friendly to Chinese writing 2. Supports WeChat official account article editing and output 3. Supports mind maps
Actually, what's missing now is a document editor with a novel UI and functions that can cover most everyday scenarios

chunks.en: @jaydenWang This is a markdown example I randomly searched online (I just used this too), https://gist.github.com/AlanDecode/7d31f3fac75b698ff1fa67240c56832, copy the content to the demo website above, and you will find several problems: 1) The rendering of the third, fourth, fifth, and sixth-level titles is incorrect 2) The table is not rendered 3) There is no indicator (black dot or hollow circle dot) in front of the unordered list 4) Should the numbers in the ordered list distinguish between parent and child levels? For example, the husband is 1, and the child is 1.1, 1.2, etc. 5) The * before the "pear" is not recognized. 6) Block quotes do not seem to be supported. 7) Functions that I think should be supported: code syntax highlighting, mathematical formulas.
Just found a bug, the following syntax will cause the text to disappear: <https://example.com>

chunks.en: My own needs, for reference only. 1. Keep the shortcuts consistent with typora to reduce migration costs. 2. Convenient image upload function. 3. Support a vault repository similar to obsidian and also support quick editing of single MD files in typora. 4. Some subtle operations are more intuitive, such as using TAB in a code block to quickly indent the desired content backwards instead of the default indentation of the entire line (speaking of you, obsidian)

chunks.en: I tried it out and found two problems. 1. I don't know how to select the language for the code block, and entering ``` goes directly into the input block. 2. I don't know how to determine when the hyperlink is outputted, for example, [baidu](www.baidu.com). When you enter www., it directly changes to the preview state. Also, I suggest adding a code theme option.

chunks.en: First, give a candy. The big guy is still awesome; he just does it. Then give a slap. I just used it a little bit, no more than 10 words. 1. After ctrl+a, you can't delete everything; you still have to delete one by one. 2. I was dumbfounded when I entered the official website, and I didn't react even after seeing the comments. Later, I understood a little bit and looked at the cursor in the upper-left corner and found out that the official website is an editor. 3. I don't know how to operate it, and sometimes I can't enter anything on the official website, and the cursor is also invisible. There are still a lot of bugs, but it's still awesome compared to people like me who only talk and don't do anything. Hehe, wry smile, grin, forced smile, silly smile

1. Add a typewriter effect on initialization, otherwise it will be very confusing when you first enter ğŸ˜³ 2. Support viewing the original MD text, and you can use a shortcut to call up the hidden text
I can't delete the first character https://s3.ivanli.cc/ivan-public/uPic/2025/GEGRxP.gif

chunks.en: Can it be written in C++? Native UI is really much faster than the current skin interface. It would be even better if the search function could introduce the full-text fuzzy search like ES. Add tags to each MD file, which can be automatically added by AI, and then let the editor add them himself. This way, you won't be afraid of not being able to find your notes when searching.

chunks.en: To be honest, my opinion is the same as #33. I can't imagine the scenario of editing a very large MD, but I still give some suggestions. These are not essential functions and may be better implemented as switches: 1. Expand the modifier when the cursor moves to the modifier: You can refer to the animation in the emacs plugin org-appear (https://github.com/awth13/org-appear) for the specific effect 2. Cloud synchronization: Or allow users to set webdav synchronization themselves 3. Comprehensive support for tables (preview, formatting, completion): I feel that large MD documents usually have a lot of tables. For the specific effect, you can refer to the vscode plugin markdowntable (https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=TakumiI.markdowntable), but I am not actually familiar with what WRIWS tables should look like. I have the impression that many editors will make a bunch of controls that are close to rich text in this area 4. vim like: Similar to ace editor and tiddlywiki's vim mode, only providing basic modal switching and key simulation, without supporting configuration.

chunks.en: I have found some things that seem to be bugs. There is no stable reproduction yet. 1. In the case of Mac, the built-in input method, and chrome browser, the Chinese input method + enter inputs the original text, and it will be repeated (enter "# asd" then press Enter, the expected result is a first-level title asd, and the actual result is a first-level title asd plus a separate body asd). 2. In the above situation, moving to the first line and deleting the character "#" will not restore the style; even if it is completely deleted, it is still in the title style. 3. In the case of 1, deleting from the end (after the body asd) has a probability of triggering 2. If 2 is not triggered, then re-entering # asd in English will not be able to wrap lines

Did you forget the underscore _? _ and * are both a pair of italics, and two pairs are bold. In addition, the image syntax seems to have some problems. After entering ![](), the cursor goes to the left inside the parenthesis, and it jumps out automatically after a second or two.

chunks.en: Superscript ~1~ ^2^ syntax is not supported, and there are major problems with the parsing of HTML tags. Entering <code> disappears directly. Also, the GFM style prompt box is not supported.
I thought WYSIWYG meant not separating the editing area and the preview area like Typora
Report a bug, the cursor is at the head of the second column of the list, and this column cannot be deleted
@hing I saw that the official website is in Typora's editing mode, but the plugin preview is not
